channel.title: Problem, need your help!
channel.description:
I recently came to turn my computer on, and it now appears with the message
\Windows\system32\winload.exe 0xc0000001 The selected entry could not be loaded because the application is missing or corrupt.
Now, sence would say "try the windows repair option" which is where my second dilemma comes into play. In the bios my DVDRW+ shows up as
SATA Master: [sup]2 2[/sup]
and is unable to boot from, Any ideas? I still have my mac laptop so I am able to do most things on here, but I need my desktop to function for downloading / games. Any help / advice is much appreciated.

item.title: Problem, need your help!
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Ollie:

I used the live USB and re-installed windows, if it breaks again I will have to replace the hard-disk to see if it makes a difference.

This happened on my old computer where system files would become corrupt, I could reinstall windows but about after a couple days it would start screwing up again. Mine had bad sectors so that might be the problem. You may want to run some diagnostics to see if thats the problem.

Read full topic

@Ollie wrote:

I used the live USB and re-installed windows, if it breaks again I will have to replace the hard-disk to see if it makes a difference.

item.title: Problem, need your help!
item.dc:creator: @darkmax darkmax
item.description:
@darkmax wrote:

If you haven’t done anything out of the ordinary, I do think that there is something wrong with your harddisk. So if your live-usb boot does not work, I would advise you to go and see if you can find your receipt or ordering slip from your harddisk, because there’s a big chance that your disk is broken.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem, need your help!
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I haven’t done anything which I wouldn’t normally do, I am going to try boot from a windows 7 live-usb as my cd-drive is knacked and wont read anything

Read full topic

item.title: Problem, need your help!
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

chrisn2323:

live cd and copy the file over?

I don’t think he can boot from his cd drive but if he could I suggest this.

Read full topic

live cd and copy the file over?

Read full topic

item.title: Problem, need your help!
item.dc:creator: @darkmax darkmax
item.description:
@darkmax wrote:

Did you make any sudden changes recently or turned of your PC during updates? Because if you don’t know why it’s producing this error, it is quite strange.
If you didn’t make any changes of turned of your PC, it may be a sign that your harddisk is failing. That it started to fail in the winload.exe file is just a bad run of luck. If you did do anything, the file might just be corrupt and you should try to hookup your harddisk to another PC to try to restore the file, either from a Windows disk or if you can’t find it on there, from a clean windows installation.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem, need your help!
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I recently came to turn my computer on, and it now appears with the message

\Windows\system32\winload.exe

0xc0000001

The selected entry could not be loaded because the application is missing or corrupt.

Now, sence would say “try the windows repair option” which is where my second dilemma comes into play. In the bios my DVDRW+ shows up as

SATA Master: [sup]2 2[/sup]

and is unable to boot from,

Any ideas? I still have my mac laptop so I am able to do most things on here, but I need my desktop to function for downloading / games.

Any help / advice is much appreciated.
